title: Multi SSH - Grid
author: plegrand1
body_snippet:
Hello,
I discovered mRemoteNG, and I must say that I am very satisfied with this application.
Under linux I was using a "multi ssh" application which allowed me to launch an ssh session on several servers.
The display allowed to see all the servers as a grid. And it was possible to launch a command on all the displayed servers simultaneously.
How is this possible with mRemoteNG?
I would like to be able to create a "new connection" with a list of servers. 
When clicking on this new connecti...

comments.snippet:
mRemoteNG unfortunately does not (yet) have the ability to allow multi-input in SSH. What you can do is arrange the windows by drag and drop so you have multiple connections next to each other. 

If you would like to use the multi-input feature, you will have to use the windows version of multissh (https://multissh.dev/). 
Then if you'd like to use it with mRemoteNG you can add a new website pointing to the multissh service (http://127.0.0.1:12321) and you're ready to go.
